com.blahti.example.drag2

Class DragView

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • com.blahti.example.drag2.DragView

  • public class DragView
extends View
    A DragView is a special view used by a DragController. During a drag operation, what is actually moving on the screen is a DragView. A DragView is constructed using a bitmap of the view the user really wants to move.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DragView(Context context, Bitmap bitmap, int registrationX, int registrationY, int left, int top, int width, int height)
      Construct the drag view.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DragView

        public DragView(Context context,
        Bitmap bitmap,
        int registrationX,
        int registrationY,
        int left,
        int top,
        int width,
        int height)
        Construct the drag view.

        The registration point is the point inside our view that the touch events should be centered upon.

        Parameters:
        context - A context
        bitmap - The view that we're dragging around. We scale it up when we draw it.
        registrationX - The x coordinate of the registration point.
        registrationY - The y coordinate of the registration point.

    • Method Detail

      • setPaint

      • show

        public void show(IBinder windowToken,
        int touchX,
        int touchY)
        Create a window containing this view and show it.
        Parameters:
        windowToken - obtained from v.getWindowToken() from one of your views
        touchX - the x coordinate the user touched in screen coordinates
        touchY - the y coordinate the user touched in screen coordinates
